intro: Oreodaphne rariflora, commonly known as the rare-flowered oreodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellowish-green in color, and it is often found in lowland evergreen forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
